DocumentationDefinitionList.Title: Formatter configuration options (Basic configuration)
DocumentationDefinitionList.Heading: Options set in the "Basic configuration" tab

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: When you select the formatter for a content item, or you add/remove formatters in the sitemap configuration, this name is presented in the select box to identify the formatter.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: The type of the resources that should be formatted with the configured formatter.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: Description of the formatter. It is shown in the element settings of a content when hovering over the question mark next to the chosen formatter.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: Formatters for resources of the same type are ordered by rank. If more than one formatter is available when you place a resource in a page, the formatter with the highest rank is chosen by default. (The choice can be altered manually via a setting that is automatically available for elements that can be formatted with different formatters.)

Description.name: Description0
Description.content:
Match defines in which containers a formatter can be applied. You can either specify containers via their width attribute or via their type attribute. If you choose width, the value specified as "Width" in the formatter configuration corresponds to the minimum width a container must have (set as width attribute), and the optional "Maximum width" specifies the maximum value of the width attribute that is allowed where the formatter is applicable.

We strongly recommend to match formatter to containers via the type.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: Check this option to make the formatter automatically available in the page editor. If the option is not checked, you can make it available via the sitemap configuration.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: If a resource is added to a page, its content may or may not be indexed for the page. If this option is checked and the resource is searchable at all, the page where it is placed will be found when you search for content of that type.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content:
If checked, nested containers exposed by the formatter, but not rendered on a container page anymore, are deleted when the container page is stored.

Example: You have a row formatter that is configured to have four columns, each exposes a nested container. Now you reconfigure the row to have only three columns and save the container page where the row is displayed on. Then the information on the container of the fourth column is removed in the container page exactly if the option is set.

It is called "Use strict containers" before OpenCms 11.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: If checked, the formatter can be used when the resource is rendered in detail view.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: If unchecked, the meta mappings are applied only if that formatter is used on a detail page. See here for details.

Entry.Term: Show element settings in content editor

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: If checked, an extra tab is added in the content editor, which allows you to edit the ellement settings there.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: If checked, the formatter is used by the tag <cms:display> if no other formatter is specified for the same resource type. Moreover, the formatter is added as option in the DisplayTypeSelectWidget.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: Resources can be previewed in the "Add wizard" or in the workplace's explorer. Check this option if the formatter should be used for such previews.
